item.title: Lynne add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "You have to resign yourself to the fact that you waste a lot of trees before you write anything you really like, and that's just the way it is. It's like learning an instrument, you've got to be prepared for hitting wrong notes occasionally, or quite a lot, cause I wrote an awful lot before I wrote anything I was really happy with. And read a lot. Reading really helps. Read anything you can get your hands on." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Ty Roth
item.description: "Unless you learn to wrap your brain around the fact that you are eventually going to die, you'll never wrap your arms around the fact that you are currently living." -- Ty Roth

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Ty Roth
item.description: "Here's a little secret:love always disappoints. It's the concious choice to love someone or not love someone, despite the disappointment, that makes it beautiful." -- Ty Roth

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Ty Roth
item.description: "Your mistake is that you've concluded life is short, so you treat it as if it's precious, like a pretty little princess. Bullshit! Everyone's life is short. Quit feeling sorry for yourself. Fuck it. Treat it like a cheap hooker. Ask crazy shit from it, and you'll get more out of life than you could have ever wanted, imagined, or deserved." -- Ty Roth

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Elizabeth Edwards
item.description: "She stood in the storm, and when the wind did not blow her way, she adjusted her sails." -- Elizabeth Edwards

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Rainbow Rowell
item.description: "Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive." -- Rainbow Rowell

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Rainbow Rowell
item.description: "I just want to break that song into pieces and love them all to death." -- Rainbow Rowell

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Ultimate Answer to Life, The Universe and Everything is...42!" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Americans have an inability to relax into sheer pleasure.Ours is an entertainment seeking-nation, but not necessarily a pleasure-seeking one....This is the cause of that great sad American stereotype- the overstressed executive who goes on vacation, but who cannot relax." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lynne add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness." -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Lynne add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Lynne add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling
